questions.text: The office ------- all next week.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) will be closed' because it refers to an action that is scheduled to happen in the future.

questions.text: The company is ------- in London.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) based' because it describes the location of the company's headquarters.

questions.text: This e-mail ------- your reservation.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) confirms' because it is the verb that matches the subject 'e-mail'.

questions.text: John is ------- the four brothers.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) the youngest of' because it properly compares John with the other brothers.

questions.text: The tourist season ------- at the end of April.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) begins' because it refers to the starting point of the tourist season.

questions.text: ------- costs is one of our most important goals.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) Reducing' because it matches the gerund form needed for the subject of the sentence.

questions.text: Many car engines will not start in cold -------.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) temperature' because it accurately describes the condition affecting car engines.

questions.text: Last month, sales ------- by more than 10%.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) fell' because it is the simple past tense of the verb 'fall', indicating a completed action.

questions.text: Most students ------- smaller classes to larger ones.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) prefer' because it indicates a preference between two options.

questions.text: The office ____ all next week.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) will be closed' because it refers to an action that is scheduled to happen in the future.

questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) based' because it describes the location of the company's headquarters.

questions.text: This e-mail ____ your reservation.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) confirms' because it is the verb that matches the subject 'e-mail'.

questions.text: John is ____ the four brothers.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) the youngest of' because it properly compares John with the other brothers.

questions.text: The tourist season ____ at the end of April.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) begins' because it refers to the starting point of the tourist season.

questions.text: ____ costs is one of our most important goals.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) Reducing' because it matches the gerund form needed for the subject of the sentence.

questions.text: Many car engines will not start in cold ____.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) temperature' because it accurately describes the condition affecting car engines.

questions.text: Last month, sales ____ by more than 10%.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) fell' because it is the simple past tense of the verb 'fall', indicating a completed action.

questions.text: Most students ____ smaller classes to larger ones.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) prefer' because it indicates a preference between two options.

questions.text: On Monday, the city made ____ in public illegal.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) smoking' because it properly completes the sentence indicating the action that was made illegal.

questions.text: About 60% of the hotel's ____ are business travelers.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) guests' because it accurately refers to the people staying at the hotel.

questions.text: The report is due ____ no later than 5:00 p.m. today.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) by' because it indicates the deadline for the report.

questions.text: Payments ____ received within 30 days of delivery.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) must be' because it indicates a requirement.

questions.text: The project ____ at least $12 million to complete.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) will cost' because it indicates the future expense to complete the project.

questions.text: Our travel arrangements were made ____ in advance.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'B) weeks' because it indicates the period of time in advance.

questions.text: The party ____ were sent out to everyone yesterday.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) invitations' because it indicates what was sent out.

questions.text: Over two hundred teachers ____ this year's annual convention.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) attended' because it correctly indicates participation in the event.

questions.text: The equipment can be operated at temperatures ____ freezing.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'B) below' because it accurately describes the temperature range.

questions.text: On ____, Americans will change careers five times during their lives.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'C) average' because it indicates the statistical likelihood.

questions.text: The meeting ____ in the conference room on the second floor.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) will take place' because it indicates a future scheduled event.

questions.text: A lack of spare parts means that the repairs ____ by about a week.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) will be delayed' because it indicates a future impact.

questions.text: ____ the storm, the city has decided that schools will be closed tomorrow.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'B) Due to' because it indicates the reason for the decision.

questions.text: The new rules ____ only to employees who were hired after January 1st.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) apply' because it indicates the rules are relevant to those employees.

questions.text: Residents list limited parking in the town center among ____ top complaints.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) their' because it correctly refers to the residents' complaints.

questions.text: She was going to go to the presentation, but ____ her mind at the last minute.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'B) changed' because it indicates a completed action in the past.

questions.text: The city's website offers useful information ____ how to start and run a small business.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'B) about' because it correctly prepositions the type of information.

questions.text: The company said that as a ____ of the recent tax increase, it will have to raise its prices.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'B) result' because it indicates the consequence of the tax increase.

questions.text: Please leave enough time at the end of your presentation to take questions from the ____.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'B) audience' because it correctly refers to the people listening to the presentation.

questions.text: On this project Mr. Flyn's ____ include being both the project manager, and the head engineer.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'A) roles' because it indicates the positions or functions he holds.

questions.text: Most students said they liked the teacher and found the class ____, but they disliked the textbook.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct choice is 'D) interesting' because it is an adjective describing the class.
